description:
NTS Map:92F7.  Rosewall Creek Provincial Park is located on Rosewall Creek, south of Fanny Bay on the east coast of Vancouver Island.
The 54.3 hectare day-use only park has picnic areas on either side of Rosewall Creek. A short trail connects the two picnic areas. 
A short wheelchair accessible loop trail runs along both sides of the river, offering great views of the river and forest. Another trail leads under the highway bridge and upstream to some spectacular views of the river. The upstream trail leads out of the park through Ministry of Forests land to a beautiful waterfall.
directions:
The trail is 3 km south of Fanny Bay. Take the Cook Creek exit from highway #19 or highway #19a; the park is located approximately 2 km from the exit.
Directions from Qualicum Beach:
Take 19A From Qualicum Beach or Parksville westerly to Bowser then to Roswell Creek Park, Trail follows SW on the Rosewell Creek. Aprox. 40 km from Qualicum Beach.
title: Rosewell Creek
